channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street light not working for months. Dangerous at night when turning into Leckhampton Place as very difficult to see pedestrians., 6th February
item.description:
Main street light on Leckhampton Road to the left of the entrance to Leckhampton Place (as you exit onto Leckhampton Road) is not working and hasn't been for ages. I reported this in November 2023 and others have also reported it and still not fixed. It's dangerous for pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 98, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Near 14-16 Linden Close

item.title: Pothole on road between the bollards, 5th February
item.description:
When travelling towards Bournside from Morrisons, there is a pothole on the left side of the road near the kerb between the bollards. Numerous times now I have tried avoiding it and consequently kerbed my wheels twice!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 124, Caernarvon Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The entire length of Caernarvon Road!!!, 5th February
item.description:
The entire length of this road is shocking to say the least. Multiple potholes, multiple patchwork repairs failing, Speed humps are like driving over kerbs. How many more times does this need reporting before proper action takes place?!! Maybe when you're done resurfacing the more affluent areas you'll give this road the attention it so desperately needs......I won't hold my breath though as this saga has been ongoing for years!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 129, Caernarvon Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle blocking public access - not the first time, 5th February
item.description:
Vehicles regularly blocking the shared path on the Honeybourne line. Workers responsible were discovered near waitrose bridge, so no excuse for blocking access where they were. This happens also with the sub station parking on the path too. It's frustrating negotiating bad and inconsiderate parking in Cheltenham.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road repaired badly, 5th February
item.description:
This road has been patched so many times it resembles one big pothole, the last repairs are woeful and will wash away when it rains. When will it be properly resurfaced?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5a;5b, Chad Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disgusting amount of rubbish, 5th February
item.description:
There is a disgusting amount of rubbish on both verges of the A40 between Cheltenham and Gloucestershire and has been for weeks. It's a really unpleasant welcome to Gloucestershire
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Large pothole/uneven road, 5th February
item.description:
Large pothole near the side of the road but difficult to avoid and very hard to see in the dark. Very poor road conditio
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Traffic over lip in road causing substantial house shaking, 5th February
item.description:
Road outside Proper House Leckhampton Lane since resurfacing end last year, any fast vehicles or heavy goods lorries clip some kind of ridge which now makes our house shake quite considerably and wakes us at night, which never happened before. Coincidentally since vibrations started, we had to replace water pipes near the site at our own expense which may have been exacerbated by vibrations from the road, & we worry other infrastructure could also be affected.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At least 2 street lights out for over a week, 5th February
item.description:
The street lights on marsland road as you come off the coronation square roundabout have not been working for over a week and it is pitch black outside on an evening without them

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Marsland Road, Fiddler's Green, Cheltenham

item.title: 2 Plastic street maintenance signs left for 2 weeks. They blow over onto narrow pavements, 5th February
item.description:
Corner of Priory Street and Priory Walk outside Nos 11 and 13 Priory Street. They have blow over several times since the rubbish clearing gang did a good job 2 weeks ago. Pavements are narrow in this area. Please remove.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priory Walk, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes and road deformation, 5th February
item.description:
Church lane, between Cottage on the Green and Brook Cottage. Multiple potholes in an unlit main access lane used by frail 80 year old pensioners to access the church, community hall and bus stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
